description:
This is a perfect canyon for your favorite little figurine to practice in extreme water flow. The flow is ultra stable at class C4 thanks to a sizable electric pump that recirculates the water through its 3 massive pools.

Approach

Park at the Foothill Ranch Library, walk North to a sidewalk going East, go East to Rue de Fortune, then South until you see the big geysers on your right. Cross the grass, try not to trample the flowers at the edge of the top pool.

Descent

Have your figurine swim out to the top of R1. Avoid swimming too close to the dangerous geysers as your figurine may be launched skyward only to fall back into the pool. Watch out the current is very swift at the top of the rock and could sweep your figurine off the slaby rock and over the 1000mm drop! Since there are no bolt installed yet, your figurine will have to come up with some clever rigging to rappel R1. Alternately, you can tie your figurine on some para-cord with a clove hitch and lower him(her) down the very sporty R1 directly in the full brunt of the waterfall. After R1 is another good swim across the middle pool to R2. R2 is not as tall at about 600mm, but presents similar hazards. After R2 is the biggest pool, where your figurine can swim as much as desired until exiting anywhere along the pools spacious banks.

If your figurine is properly trained in jumping from such extreme heights (1000mm), he(she) can dispense with any technical gear for the canyon run.

Exit

Cross back over the flower bed, then the grass back to the sidewalk. Hike uphill (North) following your approach path back to your car.

Red tape

Beta sites

Trip reports and media

Template:Pics

I think my favorite figurine took a beating on the first descent: https://www.facebook.com/willie.hunt.735/videos/10220051034618896/

Background
name: Rue de Fortuna Canyon
